intro: Metastelma barbigerum var. veracruzense, commonly known as the Veracruz metastelma, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and ample sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
